brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about a JetBrains Inspectopedia rule that checks for incorrect @Decorator bean definitions in CDI. The rule flags @Decorator beans that are final or do not have exactly one delegate attribute (field or parameter) annotated with @Delegate.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'incorrect_decorator_class' checks all classes in the project. If a class is annotated with '@Decorator', the rule asserts that the class is not final and has exactly one delegate attribute. If these conditions are not met, an error message is generated with the fully qualified name of the class.
PRE_model_validation: The rule uses the built-in functions 'getClasses', 'hasAnnotation', 'isFinal', 'countDelegateAttributes', 'getFQN', and 'msg'. It does not introduce any new functions. The rule syntax is valid according to the RSL syntax provided.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary: 1. URL: https://www.baeldung.com/cdi-decorators Summary: This page provides a detailed explanation of decorators in CDI, including how to correctly define a decorator class and its delegate attribute. It also mentions that a decorator class should not be final. 2. URL: https://docs.jboss.org/weld/reference/latest/en-US/html/decorators.html Summary: This official documentation from JBoss provides a comprehensive guide to using decorators in CDI. It explains the requirement for a delegate attribute in a decorator class.
